Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalServiceRegistry, NetworkServiceRegistry
public abstract class BaseServiceRegistry extends com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater implements ServiceRegistry, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Startable
Not public API

Base implementation of the ServiceRegistry interface for both LocalServiceRegistry and NetworkServiceRegistry. This class holds registration information added by clients through the web service API, allowing for registration and lookup of services that are uniquely identified by Port (which includes the host for the port). Service bindings are saved by ServiceRegistryStore every few seconds and on application shutdown to ensure that service registration information remains intact during a registry service update or reboot.

Construction

The constructor for this class takes a first-port parameter, which specifies the first port in the ephemeral range to allocate. Normally this argument is 50,000 which means that ports in the range between 50,000 and 65,535 (inclusive) can be allocated by the service registry if they are free.

Service Leases and Port Reservations

Calls to the method ServiceRegistry.register(Service) initiate a "lease" on a service entry in the registry, which includes exclusive access to a port that is allocated to the service by the registry. This lease will expire in a few minutes, as determined by ServiceRegistrySettings.serviceRegistrationExpirationTime(), if the client does not call the ServiceRegistry.renew(Service) method to renew the lease.

When the lease expires, the registry entry will be removed and the port will be marked as "reserved", in case the service comes back on-line within ServiceRegistrySettings.portReservationExpirationTime(). After this second expiration period, the port can be re-allocated to new clients by the registry.

The process of renewing leases is automatically handled by ServiceRegistryClient.

API Details

For details on the KivaKit service registry API, see ServiceRegistry.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
